text: Mary Rosenblum (born Mary Freeman;" Mary Freeman (my birth name)" June 27, 1952 â€“ March 11, 2018) was an American science fiction and mystery author. In 1994 she won the Compton Crook Award for Best First Novel for the novel, The Drylands. In 2009 she won the Sidewise Award for Alternate History Short Form for her story, "Sacrifice." Rosenblum was killed in an airplane crash on March 11, 2018, near an airfield south of La Center, Washington. She was 65 years old. ==References== ==Other websites== *Mary Rosenblum's website Category:1952 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Aviation deaths in the United States Category:American novelists Category:American science fiction writers Category:Writers from New York (state)
title: Mary Rosenblum
